Yes -- I missed that.  If there's an attached (specular) light pipe, I  
agree that the photon map would be the best way to go.  You could  
still get by with mkillum and standard Radiance in cases where the sun  
was not striking the curved light pipe directly, only after bouncing  
off the diffuse or semi-specular reflectors, but I'm not sure what the  
case is here.


Thanks for pointing that out.
-Greg
